text: Brasiliscincus is a genus of skinks. Species are endemic to Brazil. Species were previously placed in the genus Mabuya. ==Species== The following 3 species, listed alphabetically by specific name, are recognized as being valid: *Brasiliscincus agilis (Raddi, 1823) *Brasiliscincus caissara (Reboucas-Spieker, 1974) *Brasiliscincus heathi (Schmidt & Inger, 1951) – Brazilian mabuya Nota bene: A binomial authority in parentheses indicates that the species was originally described in a genus other than Brasiliscincus. ==References== Category:Lizard genera Category:Endemic fauna of Brazil Category:Reptiles of Brazil Category:Taxa named by Stephen Blair Hedges Category:Taxa named by Caitlin E. Conn
title: Brasiliscincus
